title: "Lee Sin is OP, low elo brings down his win rate"
body:
Meanwhile, he has a 47% win rate in diamond lol. Lucian has a 46% win rate. Jayce has a 46% win rate. Vayne has a 47% win rate. Leblanc has a 47.7% win rate. Master "Noob Stomper" Yi has a 48% win rate. Zed has a 49% win rate.
Janna has a 55% win rate in diamond and 34.6% popularity in diamond, but people aren't happy about her nerfs lol.
http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/diamond/by-winrate

People should stop acting like they are better at balancing games than professionals running one of the most balanced games on the market. And to the quote "win rate doesn't mean anything," lol it literally is how often that champion will win if played. The average diamond player will only win 49% of games with Zed. So much for OP.

replies.body:
Your point regarding the people who know balance is entirely correct, but they're not basing it off of winrate, which should be ignored as far as statistics go. It's pretty much a useless number. Winrate isn't used as a reference because *there are too many other variables in play per game.* Now, it is somewhat suggestive of a champion's nature in relation to each other, but nothing concrete or useful for seeing how well a champion is performing.

Warwick had a 55+% winrate for a while despite not having been buffed or changed. The rest of the game simply changed around him in a way that made him oppressive. Ashe and Zyra received a boost to their winrate back in S3, not because either of them was especially strong, but because they would be taken together bot lane. And because I know that won't convince you, what is the average score in each ranked bracket for each of the champions you listed? How often are they picked in each bracket? What do they build? How often are they picked/ignored by professionals (people who make money off of playing in the most optimized fashion)? How well do they perform at a professional level? Is there a difference in any of this in between the various servers?

All of the questions I asked are at least somewhat useful when discussing balance. Winrate isn't a part of that discussion, and shouldn't be.

Win rates are only part of the picture.
Pick/Ban rates.
K/D/A
Who deals what kind of numbers in damage, healing, sustain, ect.
Not to mention, high elo play is mostly about who makes the first mistake vs who capitalizes on it first.
I just don't comment on threads that people say silly things like OP.

Op
Cancer
Freelo

Stuff like that makes me want to instantly downvote someone, but I do try to at least read it.

Granted, I still think a lot of people need to go to lolwiki and read up on champs before talking about them, they'd have a better understanding of the champion they wish to deconstruct.
Lee for example, I don't see a real problem with his kit except for two things.
One is his energy return is too reliable.
Two is that he's the only bruiser with two viable gap closers.
Typically, assassins lack hard CC.
Bruisers may have a minor form of gap closer, but are fairly lacking in mobility.
Lee has both, it's the only frustrating aspect of his kit imo.

The fact that Janna is being nerfed shows an obvious flaw in Riot's balance philosophy. Janna is a counter to certain play styles and comps, apparently she is a strong enough counter to the current meta that her win rate is going up. 

So instead of trying to think outside the meta, we are going to nerf her so that the current faceroller towerdiver meta goes on. WP again Rito.

Janna... is thinking outside the meta?

She's easily the support that's spent the most time being OP in League history. She isn't, nor has she ever been niche lol
Did you hear Sona is getting more nerfs?

You know.. I have this feeling that these kinds of supports are getting nerfed because they arent as flashy and entertaining to watch. Riot knows there's big money in the "competitive" scene, and they probably want "pro" teams picking champs that make flashy plays, not the ones that are good at stopping flashy plays like {{champion:40}} or sustain based ones like {{champion:37}} .

Nope, {{champion:412}} should continue having litterally everything in his kit, and so should {{champion:64}} because they make fancy plays that make people want to watch the competitions.

Pros and Diamond players are not the entire game.  They are actually a minority when compared to the entire population.  Riot balances things based on the higher ranks a little too hard.  If Lee is truly not a problem in the high ranks(which I find very hard to believe), then nerfing him so he isn't a problem in the low ranks won't hurt anyone.
How do you nerf him for low rank without gutting him at high rank?

It wouldn't be pretty, but basically ruin him until some kinda rework comes along.  They've done it before, and it does kinda suck, but I honestly think its better than just letting them run the show.

If he's really only a problem in lower elos then it'd be a hell of alot harder to fix him than I'm thinking, but I think it's still doable.

The only champs that get nerfed hard enough to be considered "ruined" are champs with aspects so toxic or broken that they can't be balanced.
Lee Sin may have a crap ton of stuff in his kit, but individually each aspect is balanced.
It's when you put it all together that you realize he's a jack of all trades.  Other champs can do certain things better than him.
But the fact is, he can just just about everything decently.  And what he can't do, his other aspects can make up for.

As far as reworks go, he doesn't really need one I don't think.  There are a lot of champs that needs work a lot more than him.
